laboratory_examinations.findings: Hematocrit 44%, white-cell count 9000 per cubic millimeter (63% neutrophils, 17% lymphocytes, 8% monocytes, 11% eosinophils, 1% basophils), platelet count 391,000 per cubic millimeter, erythrocyte sedimentation rate 22 mm per hour.

Hematocrit 44%, white-cell count 6300 per cubic millimeter (56% neutrophils, 20% lymphocytes, 11% monocytes, 12% eosinophils, 1% basophils), platelet count 349,000 per cubic millimeter, erythrocyte sedimentation rate 23 mm per hour.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: White-cell count decreased from 9000 to 6300 per cubic millimeter.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Urine positive for protein; sediment contained 2 to 4 red cells per low-power field.
No change in bilateral opacities, no new lesions, no lymphadenopathy or pleural effusions.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: No change noted from previous scans.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Positive for c-ANCA, enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay positive for antibodies to proteinase 3 at a titer of 1718 U (normal value, less than 5 U).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Indicates a significant risk for pulmonary hemorrhage and rapidly progressive glomerulonephritis, titer of ANCA fell after treatment.
